headline.main: URGES PRESIDENT TO LIFT SHIP BAN; Pepper Says Neutrality Law Gives Power to Revoke as Well as Impose Curbs

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 2 -- While administrative authorities continued their study today of plans for removing the restrictions of the Neutrality acts on American shipping, Senator Pepper of Florida, forecaster of many foreign policy moves in the past, urged President Roosevelt to revoke the proclamations which had brought the act into force.
abstract: Predicts Cong action on Neutrality Act revision
